SYNOPSIS: 

This position is primarily responsible for preventative maintenance and troubleshooting of the automated storage & retrieval system (AS/RS). The AS/RS Technician II must be proficient in reading system schematics, diagnosing complex hardware and control issues, and coordinating directly with logistics personnel and Viastore hotline support to resolve system errors. This role includes documenting all maintenance activities, error resolutions, and work orders in the facility CMMS software system. The AS/RS Technician II will also support broader facility maintenance tasks as prioritized by the Facilities Manager. Facilities personnel are expected to perform their duties in a manner that ensures the safety of themselves and all employees. Success in this role requires strong technical expertise, independent decision-making, and effective communication within a team environment. 

 

COMPETENCY PROFILE:  

Global Competencies: Collaborate; Deliver Results; Develop Yourself; Drive Customer Value; Improve and Innovate; Take Ownership 

 

RESPONSIBILITIES: 

Independently perform preventative maintenance of the distribution center’s AS/RS and conveyor equipment. 

Perform routine scheduled work orders across logistics automation systems. 

Independently identify, troubleshoot, and resolve complex logistics system failures. 

Serve as the primary contact with OEMs (Viastore and other sub-contractors) for system diagnostics and corrective actions. 

Document and manage the use of spare parts, ensuring appropriate inventory replenishment. 

Analyze and report on system performance metrics to support continuous improvement. 

Coordinate with sub-contractors for system upgrades, repairs, and performance enhancements. 

Provide training and guidance to warehouse team leaders and Technician I staff on system errors and routine troubleshooting. 

Maintain and update the preventative maintenance schedule in the facility’s CMMS software tool. 

Participate in logistics planning shift meetings and contribute to maintenance strategy discussions. 

Document detailed “history logs” in CMMS software to build a knowledge base for future reference. 

Perform general facilities maintenance tasks as time permits and as prioritized by the Facilities Manager. 

Adhere to all OSHA and company safety protocols during maintenance procedures. 

Follow environmental guidelines for the proper use and disposal of materials. 

Other duties as assigned. 

 

QUALIFICATIONS:  

High School Diploma or GED. 

3–5 years of experience in logistics automation or industrial maintenance, with at least 1–2 years in an ASRS Technician I or equivalent role.  

Proficient in reading and interpreting engineering drawings, schematics, and control diagrams. 

Strong understanding of automated systems, PLCs, and industrial controls. 

Demonstrated ability to lead troubleshooting efforts and mentor junior technicians. 

Proficient in Microsoft Office and CMMS software tools. 

Strong organizational and decision-making skills; ability to prioritize tasks in a dynamic environment. 

Demonstrates a willingness to collaborate with others, build relationships, and involve others in decision making.  

Demonstrates the ability to deliver results by solving or supporting others in solving problems, prioritizing tasks, and/or resources, and focusing on outcomes.  

Demonstrates self-awareness and the willingness to learn and grow, accept changes, and effectively adapt to changing work demands.  

Demonstrates the ability to drive customer value through knowledge of the business, putting effort into identifying customer needs, and delivering work to maximize the value for customers.  

Demonstrates a willingness to promote the value of improvement and innovation by staying ahead of trends, creating ideas and opportunities, and generating speed.  

Demonstrates a willingness to take ownership by making decisions, taking responsibility, and driving things forward.  

 

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS: 

Must be able to stand for 8 hours a day. 

Must be able to lift 60 pounds. 

Must have a valid driver’s license and be able to use own vehicle for local trips to Home Depot, etc. (with reimbursement). 

Must be able to work flexible hours, including evenings, weekends, and PRN overtime. 

Must be willing to support the facility maintenance team in a collaborative environment. 

Must be able to handle extreme temperatures. 

Must be able to drive for up to 2 hours. 

Must be able to speak and understand English to communicate verbally and in writing. 

Regular and on-time attendance.

SYNOPSIS:  The Data Modeler Specialist role plays a key role in designing, implementing, and managing data models that support business processes and decision-making for the organization. The Data Modeler Specialist designs, implements, and documents data architecture and data modeling solutions.  These solutions encompass a variety of database technologies. In addition, the role supports enterprise information management, business intelligence, machine learning, data science, and other business interests.  Under specific direction, this position will utilize various enterprise tools to provide data modeling services to the organization utilizing best practices in data management. Core functions include but are not limited to conceptual, logical, and physical data modeling, data profiling, data quality, and source-to-target mapping. Experience in data warehouse concepts, business requirements gathering and analysis, source system evaluation, and master data management concepts. The position will work collaboratively with local and international colleagues, both from within Information Technology and the business.  This role will entail working on and leading critical data-related projects, ensuring efficient and effective data management for the organization.

This senior analyst position will analyze and document business requirements, as well as recommend and/or develop user-oriented solutions in the functional areas of the Business. As a thought leader, he/she will identify the organization’s process strengths and weaknesses and will suggest areas for improvement. 

 

COMPETENCY PROFILE: 

Job-Specific Competencies: Communication; Building Collaborative Relationships; Diagnostic Information Gathering; Analytical Thinking; Developing Others; Technical Expertise 

Global Competencies: Collaborate; Deliver Results; Develop Yourself; Drive Customer Value; Improve and Innovate; Take Ownership 

 

RESPONSIBILITIES: 

Perform set-ups/configuration of ERP software, specifically SAP.    

Provide thought and knowledge leadership in business areas of Finance and Accounting. 

Provide application support, as well as coordinating work with internal and external resources. 

Perform project management as required for business process improvement projects. 

Communicate project status regularly with project teams and end users. 

Actively participate in the development and implementation of enhancements in the areas of Finance and Accounting. 

Perform application version updates, including working with vendors, completing test plans, and implementation. 

Develop and execute system testing; create use cases, develop and execute test plans, and facilitate the user acceptance testing effort. 

Provide business systems technical support by: 

Develop user and technical support documentation and provide user training. 

Providing post-implementation process and technical support. 

Provide advance support for various applications and business processes. 

Working with vendor, headquarters, and internal key users in the organization for 	s			                  support and problem resolution, as required. 

Working with Infrastructure and Operational Solutions (IT-IOS) to design,       		implement and maintain solutions in support of our applications. 

Coordinate efforts to ensure optimum system resources and capacity are available for  

efficient application operation and high availability.  

Coordinate activities and tasks with vendors and internal project teams. 

Translate business needs into requirement documents and functional specifications. 

Lead resources and system application management in support, customer service, and task prioritization. 

Provide clear written and verbal communication.

Identifies the information needed to clarify a situation, seeking that information from appropriate sources, and using skillful questioning to draw out the information when others are reluctant to disclose it.  

Use analytic skills to perform problem solving and provide solutions. 

Delegates responsibilities and works with/coaches others to develop their capabilities.  

Demonstrates knowledge and skill in technical areas.

Demonstrates an honest and forthright presence by taking responsibility for own mistakes and not blaming others, and by doing what he/she commits to doing. 

Works as a team player to make a difference within the business and expresses gratitude and appreciation to others who have provided information, assistance, or support. 

Readily handles change through taking advantage of lifelong learning opportunities and being open minded and curious in the face of new challenges. 

Other duties as assigned.

Bachelor’s Degree in CIS/BIS and 7-years’ experience, or associate degree and 8-years’ experience, as a Business Systems Analyst in Finance.

General Ledger 

Profit Centers 

Cost Centers 

Fixed Assets 

Banks 

Vendors 

AR & AP Processing 

Credit Management 

SAP roll-out experience preferred. 

Integrating and interfacing systems experience is required. 

Strong project management skills are required. 

Knowledge of relational database systems, as well as Oracle SQL and PL/SQL, is required. 

The ability to adjust quickly to rapidly changing priorities is required. 

 	Strong communication skills with the ability to work effectively at all levels in the company 	are required. 

Six Sigma / Lean experience is a plus. 

ITIL foundations certification, is preferred. 

The ability to manage projects across technical and functional disciplines is required. 

The ability to execute assigned project tasks within an established schedule is essential.

Demonstrates a willingness to promote the value of improvement and innovation by staying ahead of trends, creating ideas and opportunities, and generating speed.  

Demonstrates a willingness to take ownership by making decisions, taking responsibility, and driving things forward.
